title: Greggs Sausage Roll
description: Make Greggs Sausage Roll at home with this easy UK copycat recipe — familiar flavours, simple steps and supermarket ingredients.
introText: Recreate Greggs Sausage Roll at home with UK supermarket ingredients. This copycat keeps the flavour profile you know and love while staying weeknight-friendly.

children.text: This fakeaway is inspired by Greggs in the UK. The method adapts for the home kitchen while preserving the core taste and texture.
Preheat oven to 200°C (fan 180°C).
Mix sausage meat with onion powder, garlic granules, salt and pepper.
Roll out puff pastry; portion filling along the centre lines.
Brush edges with egg wash, fold and seal; crimp with a fork.
Cut into rolls, score tops and brush with egg wash.
Bake 20–25 minutes until puffed and deep golden.

tips: Taste and adjust seasoning — different brands vary.
Avoid overcrowding pans for better browning and crispiness.
Batch-cook and freeze for quick midweek fakeaways.

faqs.question: Can I make this ahead?
faqs.answer: Yes. Prep elements earlier and assemble or reheat just before serving.

faqs.question: Can I freeze leftovers?
faqs.answer: Most components freeze up to 3 months. Reheat thoroughly until piping hot.
